page.title: 03Holy Family Chapel
page.content: With the help of the parishoners the house was turned into a presbytery, with a chapel to seat 20 people built in the cellar. This chapel was used for daily mass, the school hall being used for Sunday mass.{Father Breandan McDonald,}the curate from St. Joseph's, became the first parish priest and moved into the presbytery in September 1975. During the next few years, plans for the purchase of the remaining land of the original 2.5 acre site in order to build a church and parochial centre were put before Cheshire County Council. Permission was granted in 1975, and in December 1977, Bishop Grasar officially opened the Â£90,000 church and parish centre.
